title: Olaf's R is always cited as the reason he can't be truly balanced or viable
body:
I don't think this is the case. 

Kayle can ignore Damage for a duration and is seen as completely fine. Why? Her kit isn't broken on it's own. 

It's his R + THE REST OF HIS KIT not just the R alone. 

Lets look at his kit:

P: Offensive stat that punishes the enemy for damaging Olaf and rewards him for taking damage

Q: Ranged Slow nuke that either stomps them 100% of the time or 0% of the time because of how a spammable slow works

W: Activate for free stats that scales with how much damage you took

E: Spammable true damage that scales with AD 

R: Free Armor/MR that turns into a massive amount of AD when Activated

Conclusion: **His kit was made to be unbeatable. They gave him thing after thing to patch up weaknesses without giving him a real strength. His strength is that he has no real weakness that other Melees don't have.** What is his weakness? He is kiteable. What are his strengths? insert list of 12+ things that are super general

Why does this matter? 

What does becoming Immune to CC do? It makes it so **you can't be stopped or kited and so you can get off your damage without being destroyed**

Why is this a problem on Olaf's kit? 

His entire purpose as a character is to run forward and kill you. **A skilled Olaf is only one that caught up to the guy, not one who used his abilities in a strategic manner.** I don't really see how in the world that could be called skilled for any modern design of a Champion. His entire success is based on whether or not he could catch the enemy, aka whether or not the enemy was bad enough that he/she let Olaf catch them. **So skilled.**

Either he succeeds with minimal counterplay or he doesn't and he falls completely flat on his face. Instead of being centered around Relentlessness and skilled usage of Axes and combat, his Q is only there to slow them and his R is only there for him to catch you. 

Conversely, a Kayle kit that was centered around her R instead of her R serving her kit would be very different. It would probably look at like a Ranged Poppy. Kayle doesn't use her R to dive an entire team and ignore basic principles of the game, she uses it the re-position. Olaf uses his R to be Olaf. This is the major difference. 

**What would a Relentless Berserker kit look like if it were centered around his Q rather than his R? **

P: Autoattacks and Axes give a Health Shield that lasts 4 seconds that stacks up to 12 times. Scales with Total AD per shield stack. No internal CD.

Q: Axe throw with a charge system. Axes can be picked up after tossed. Max 2/3/4/5/6 charges. Less damage than on Live. CD inbetween charges is longer than Live CD but Axes are more visible and last a lot longer than on live. Speed, CD and damage of Axes directly scale with Attack Speed. Axes also apply On hit effects and Crit at a % value based on rank.

W: Dashes to an Axe at a fast speed, knocking aside and damaging all targets he runs thru. Passively gains flat MS when running towards an Axe. Cannot be interrupted or stopped by either Olaf or an Enemy. Can cast QER while dashing. 

E: Summons the Wrath of the Gods to strike all live Qs with Lightning dealing AoE damage and Slowing to units within the range of the Axes. Slowing field remains briefly after the strike.

R: Passive shield values doubled, tosses multiple Qs per cast, W speed increased and E AoE Slow and Range increased. Additionally, breaks free of all CC upon cast.

replies.body: I'd rather play the current sort of shitty Olaf than the one you've proposed, to be honest.
Yeah. Olaf's entire identity is based around all the "flaws" that this guy just mentioned. If you remove all that, he is no longer Olaf. He is "Mad Axe Wielding Viking #2000."

On one hand, I like it.

On the other hand, its not Olaf. Its just some other axe wielding berserker. For better or for worse, Olaf's defining ability is the core of Ragnarok, the ability to remove and ignore CC. That's what makes Olaf...well, Olaf. It'd be like Annie without Tibbers, Yi without Highlander, Darius without the dunks. It can work. But its not the same guy anymore.

Olaf, and every other bruiser with no gap closer has alot more nuance than you give them credit for. It takes a lot of experience to know not only when to go in and whether or not you even can. I see so many Mundo's, Olaf's, and Shyvana's fail so hard because they try to dive when they simply can't, and they make themselves useless. They may be rather simple champions mechanically but their decision making is actually rather complicated. You have to know how much peel the enemy team has, how many escapes your intended target has, you have to keep track of all those tools, all while figuring out what you ought to be doing until the moment to go in arrives.
Implying Juggling Axes whilst still autoing to reach maximum damage output on Olaf does not take mechanical skill.
The Olaf rework that you suggested sounds cool to be honest. I wouldn't mind either seeing that exact rework on Olaf or an another champion entirely.

Morgana has the same problem, or had the same problem. Back when we saw here support every game due to the black shield.
